criteria: Collection and Use of Primary Sources
Collection and Use of Secondary Sources
Analysis and Interpretation of Historical Evidence
descriptions: No primary sources are included or attempted.
Limited attempt to include primary sources, but sources are irrelevant or inaccurately presented.
Some primary sources are included, but their connection to the family history is weak or unclear.
Adequate collection of primary sources relevant to tracing family history; sources are generally well-integrated.
Comprehensive and relevant primary sources are skillfully used to trace family history.
Exceptional use of diverse primary sources provides deep insight into family history with thoughtful analysis.
No secondary sources are included or attempted.
Limited attempt to include secondary sources, but sources are irrelevant or inaccurately presented.
Some secondary sources are included, but their connection to the family history is weak or unclear.
Adequate collection of secondary sources relevant to tracing family history; sources are generally well-integrated.
Comprehensive and relevant secondary sources are skillfully used to trace family history.
Exceptional use of diverse secondary sources provides deep insight into family history with thoughtful analysis.
No attempt to analyze or interpret sources.
Superficial analysis with misinterpretations of historical data.
Basic analysis with some accurate interpretations, but lacks depth.
Sound analysis and interpretation of historical sources to support the family history.
Insightful analysis, demonstrating a nuanced understanding of historical context and its impact on the family.
Sophisticated and insightful analysis that provides a compelling and original interpretation of family history within a broader historical framework.
Presentation is disorganized and unclear, making it difficult to follow the family history.
Presentation is somewhat disorganized with limited clarity.
Presentation is generally clear, but some aspects are disorganized or confusing.
Presentation is well-organized and clear, effectively communicating the family history.
Presentation is engaging, exceptionally clear, and well-structured, enhancing the understanding of family history.
Presentation is creative, exceptionally clear, and meticulously organized, creating a captivating narrative of the family history.
